sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Str.Trim function takes the string str and returns a string in all the leading and trailing spaces (the spaces at the beginning and the end) are deleted. For example, Str.Trim (" This is a test ") returns "This is a test". If str only has spaces in it, then Str.Trim will return an empty string.
sections.text_content:
The Str.Trim function takes the string str and returns
          a string in all the leading and trailing spaces (the spaces at the
          beginning and the end) are deleted. For example, 
          Str.Trim ("   This is a test ") returns
          "This is a test". If str only has spaces in it, then
          Str.Trim will return an empty string.
sections.mdown_content: The **Str.Trim** function takes the string *str* and returnsa string in all the leading and trailing spaces (the spaces at thebeginning and the end) are deleted. For example, Str.Trim ("   This is a test ") returns"This is a test". If *str* only has spaces in it, then**Str.Trim** will return an empty string.

sections.title: Example
code:
var line : string
        loop
            put "Enter a non-empty line of text: " ..
            get line : *
            exit when Str.Trim (line) not= ""
        end loop
        put "You entered ", line
sections.raw_content:
This program obtains input from the user until the user enters a line
      with non-whitespace characters in it.
